snippet: Four aid workers who were abducted May 22 were freed early Saturday in a NATO rescue operation in northern Afghanistan.
abstract: Four aid workers, including two women, who were abducted by insurgents in May are freed in a NATO rescue operation in northern Afghanistan;

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and JOHN F. BURNS
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Kabul, and John F. Burns from London. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Four aid workers who were abducted May 22 were freed early Saturday in a NATO rescue operation in northern Afghanistan.

headline.seo: Aid Workers in Afghanistan Are Rescued From Remote Cave
headline.main: Aid Workers Who Were Held in Cave Are Rescued From Taliban
headline.print_headline: Aid Workers Held in Cave Are Rescued From Taliban
